member.name: M:BabBot.Manager.ProcessManager.Initialize
member.summary: Search for the TLS and Initialize the bot once the user is logged in

member.name: E:BabBot.Manager.ProcessManager.WoWProcessFailed
member.summary: ProcessFailed is fired if an exception is thrown when attempting to start the process.

member.name: E:BabBot.Manager.ProcessManager.WoWProcessEnded
member.summary: ProcessEnded is fired where the started process exits.

member.name: E:BabBot.Manager.ProcessManager.WoWProcessStarted
member.summary: ProcessStarted is fired if the process successfully starts.

member.name: E:BabBot.Manager.ProcessManager.WoWProcessAccessFailed
member.summary: ProcessAccessFailed is fired if the current user does not have permission to access the new process.

member.name: T:BabBot.Manager.ProcessManager.WoWProcessAccessFailedEventHandler
member.summary: Error is the Win32Exception.Message thrown.

member.name: T:BabBot.Manager.ProcessManager.WoWProcessEndedEventHandler
member.summary: Process is the ID of the process that exited.

member.name: T:BabBot.Manager.ProcessManager.WoWProcessFailedEventHandler
member.summary: Error is the Win32Exception.Message thrown.

member.name: T:BabBot.Manager.ProcessManager.WoWProcessStartedEventHandler
member.summary: Process is the ID of the process that started.

member.name: M:BabBot.Common.AppHelper.GetWowInstallationPath
member.summary: Get the installation path from the registry
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the installation path else is null.

member.name: M:BabBot.Common.AppHelper.IsVista

member.returns: true if application is running on Vista false if application is running on different OS

member.returns: return Process if the function succeeds

member.returns: return Process if the function succeeds else null

member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:BabBot.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: M:BabBot.Program.Main
member.summary: The main entry point for the application.

member.name: T:BabBot.Wow.ObjectManager
member.summary: This class contains all of the properties and methods used to access WoW's internal linked lists of objects.

member.name: M:BabBot.Common.RunAs.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes default values for all parameters.
member.remarks:
The following default values are assigned:
Parameter
Default Value
UserName
System.Environment.UserName
Domain
System.Environment.UserDomainName
Password
Empty string ("")
ApplicationName
CurrentProcess.StartInfo.FileName
LogonFlagsInstance
LogonFlags.WithProfile
CommandLine
System.Environment.CommandLine
CreationFlagsInstance
CreationFlags.NewConsole
CurrentDirectory
System.Environment.CurrentDirectory
Environment
IntPtr.Zero
StartupInfo
New StartUpInfo instance with the following values set: -- cb is set to the size of the instance -- dwFlags is set to StartUpInfoFlags.UseCountChars --dwYCountChars is set to 50 --lpTitle is set to CurrentProcess.MainWindowTitle
ProcessInfo
New ProcessInformation instance

member.name: M:BabBot.Common.RunAs.CreateProcessWithLogonW(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.String,BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo@,BabBot.Common.RunAs.ProcessInformation@)
member.summary: The CreateProcessWithLogonW function creates a new process and its primary thread. The new process then runs the specified executable file in the security context of the specified credentials (user, domain, and password). It can optionally load the user profile for the specified user.

member.name: M:BabBot.Common.RunAs.CloseHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Closes an open object handle.

member.name: M:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartProcess(System.String,System.String,System.String,BabBot.Common.RunAs.LogonFlags,System.String,System.String,BabBot.Common.RunAs.CreationFlags,System.IntPtr,System.String,BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo@,BabBot.Common.RunAs.ProcessInformation@)
member.summary: Creates a new process and its primary thread. The new process then runs the specified executable file in the security context of the specified credentials (user, domain, and password). It can optionally load the user profile for the specified user.
member.param: This is the name of the user account to log on to. If you use the UPN format, user@domain, the Domain parameter must be NULL. The user account must have the Log On Locally permission on the local computer.
Specifies the name of the domain or server whose account database contains the user account. If this parameter is NULL, the user name must be specified in UPN format.
Specifies the clear-text password for the user account.
Logon option. This parameter can be zero or one value from the LogonFlags enum.

Specifies the module to execute. The specified module can be a Windows-based application. It can be some other type of module (for example, MS-DOS or OS/2) if the appropriate subsystem is available on the local computer. The string can specify the full path and file name of the module to execute or it can specify a partial name. In the case of a partial name, the function uses the current drive and current directory to complete the specification. The function will not use the search path. If the file name does not contain an extension, .exe is assumed. Therefore, if the file name extension is .com, this parameter must include the .com extension. The appname parameter can be NULL. In that case, the module name must be the first white space-delimited token in the commandline string. If the executable module is a 16-bit application, appname should be NULL, and the string pointed to by commandline should specify the executable module as well as its arguments.

Specifies the command line to execute. The maximum length of this string is 32,000 characters. The commandline parameter can be NULL. In that case, the function uses the string pointed to by appname as the command line. If the file name does not contain an extension, .exe is appended. Therefore, if the file name extension is .com, this parameter must include the .com extension. If the file name ends in a period with no extension, or if the file name contains a path, .exe is not appended. If the file name does not contain a directory path, the system searches for the executable file.

Use CreationFlags and PriorityFlags enums. Controls how the process is created. Also controls the new process's priority class, which is used to determine the scheduling priorities of the process's threads.

Specifies the full path to the current directory for the process. The string can also specify a UNC path. If this parameter is NULL, the new process will have the same current drive and directory as the calling process.
Pointer to an environment block for the new process. If this parameter is NULL, the new process uses the environment of the specified user instead of the environment of the calling process.
Specifies the window station, desktop, standard handles, and appearance of the main window for the new process.
ProcessInformation structure that receives identification information for the new process, including a handle to the process.
member.returns: Returns a System.Diagnostic.Process which will be null if the call failed.
member.exception: Throws a System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception containing the last error if the call failed.

member.name: M:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartProcess(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new process and its primary thread. The new process then runs the specified executable file in the security context of the specified credentials (user, domain, and password). It can optionally load the user profile for the specified user.
member.param: This is the name of the user account to log on to. If you use the UPN format, user@domain, the Domain parameter must be NULL. The user account must have the Log On Locally permission on the local computer.
Specifies the name of the domain or server whose account database contains the user account. If this parameter is NULL, the user name must be specified in UPN format.
Specifies the clear-text password for the user account.

Specifies the module to execute. The specified module can be a Windows-based application. It can be some other type of module (for example, MS-DOS or OS/2) if the appropriate subsystem is available on the local computer. The string can specify the full path and file name of the module to execute or it can specify a partial name. In the case of a partial name, the function uses the current drive and current directory to complete the specification. The function will not use the search path. If the file name does not contain an extension, .exe is assumed. Therefore, if the file name extension is .com, this parameter must include the .com extension. The appname parameter can be NULL. In that case, the module name must be the first white space-delimited token in the commandline string. If the executable module is a 16-bit application, appname should be NULL, and the string pointed to by commandline should specify the executable module as well as its arguments.

Specifies the command line to execute. The maximum length of this string is 32,000 characters. The commandline parameter can be NULL. In that case, the function uses the string pointed to by appname as the command line. If the file name does not contain an extension, .exe is appended. Therefore, if the file name extension is .com, this parameter must include the .com extension. If the file name ends in a period with no extension, or if the file name contains a path, .exe is not appended. If the file name does not contain a directory path, the system searches for the executable file.

Specifies the full path to the current directory for the process. The string can also specify a UNC path. If this parameter is NULL, the new process will have the same current drive and directory as the calling process.
member.returns: Returns a System.Diagnostic.Process which will be null if the call failed.
member.exception: Throws a System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception containing the last error if the call failed.

member.name: M:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartProcess(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)

Specifies the name of the domain or server whose account database contains the user account. If this parameter is NULL, the user name must be specified in UPN format.
Specifies the clear-text password for the user account.

Specifies the command line to execute. The maximum length of this string is 32,000 characters. The commandline parameter can be NULL. In that case, the function uses the string pointed to by appname as the command line. If the file name does not contain an extension, .exe is appended. Therefore, if the file name extension is .com, this parameter must include the .com extension. If the file name ends in a period with no extension, or if the file name contains a path, .exe is not appended. If the file name does not contain a directory path, the system searches for the executable file.
member.returns: Returns a System.Diagnostic.Process which will be null if the call failed.
member.exception: Throws a System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception containing the last error if the call failed.

Specifies the module to execute. The specified module can be a Windows-based application. It can be some other type of module (for example, MS-DOS or OS/2) if the appropriate subsystem is available on the local computer. The string can specify the full path and file name of the module to execute or it can specify a partial name. In the case of a partial name, the function uses the current drive and current directory to complete the specification. The function will not use the search path. Use CreationFlags and PriorityFlags enums. Controls how the process is created. Also controls the new process's priority class, which is used to determine the scheduling priorities of the process's threads.

member.name: M:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartProcess
member.summary: Creates a new process and its primary thread. The new process then runs the specified executable file in the security context of the specified credentials (user, domain, and password). It can optionally load the user profile for the specified user.

member.name: P:BabBot.Common.RunAs.UserName
member.summary: This is the name of the user account to log on to. If you use the UPN format, user@domain, the Domain parameter must be NULL. The user account must have the Log On Locally permission on the local computer.

member.name: P:BabBot.Common.RunAs.Domain
member.summary: Specifies the name of the domain or server whose account database contains the user account. If this parameter is NULL, the user name must be specified in UPN format.

member.name: P:BabBot.Common.RunAs.Password
member.summary: Specifies the clear-text password for the user account.

member.name: P:BabBot.Common.RunAs.LogonFlagsInstance
member.summary: Logon option. This parameter can be zero or one value from the LogonFlags enum.

member.name: P:BabBot.Common.RunAs.ApplicationName
member.summary: Specifies the module to execute. The specified module can be a Windows-based application. It can be some other type of module (for example, MS-DOS or OS/2) if the appropriate subsystem is available on the local computer. The string can specify the full path and file name of the module to execute or it can specify a partial name. In the case of a partial name, the function uses the current drive and current directory to complete the specification. The function will not use the search path. If the file name does not contain an extension, .exe is assumed. Therefore, if the file name extension is .com, this parameter must include the .com extension. The appname parameter can be NULL. In that case, the module name must be the first white space-delimited token in the commandline string. If the executable module is a 16-bit application, appname should be NULL, and the string pointed to by commandline should specify the executable module as well as its arguments.

member.name: P:BabBot.Common.RunAs.CommandLine
member.summary: Specifies the command line to execute. The maximum length of this string is 32,000 characters. The commandline parameter can be NULL. In that case, the function uses the string pointed to by appname as the command line. If the file name does not contain an extension, .exe is appended. Therefore, if the file name extension is .com, this parameter must include the .com extension. If the file name ends in a period with no extension, or if the file name contains a path, .exe is not appended. If the file name does not contain a directory path, the system searches for the executable file.

member.name: P:BabBot.Common.RunAs.CreationFlagsInstance
member.summary: Use CreationFlags and PriorityFlags enums. Controls how the process is created. Also controls the new process's priority class, which is used to determine the scheduling priorities of the process's threads.

member.name: P:BabBot.Common.RunAs.CurrentDirectory
member.summary: Specifies the full path to the current directory for the process. The string can also specify a UNC path. If this parameter is NULL, the new process will have the same current drive and directory as the calling process.

member.name: P:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartupInfo
member.summary: Specifies the window station, desktop, standard handles, and appearance of the main window for the new process.

member.name: P:BabBot.Common.RunAs.ProcessInfo
member.summary: ProcessInformation structure that receives identification information for the new process, including a handle to the process.

member.name: P:BabBot.Common.RunAs.Environment
member.summary: Pointer to an environment block for the new process. If this parameter is NULL, the new process uses the environment of the specified user instead of the environment of the calling process.

member.name: T:BabBot.Common.RunAs.CreationFlags
member.summary: Controls how the process is created. The DefaultErrorMode, NewConsole, and NewProcessGroup flags are enabled by defaultâ€” even if you do not set the flag, the system will function as if it were set.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.CreationFlags.Suspended
member.summary: The primary thread of the new process is created in a suspended state, and does not run until the ResumeThread function is called.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.CreationFlags.NewConsole
member.summary: The new process has a new console, instead of inheriting the parent's console.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.CreationFlags.NewProcessGroup
member.summary: The new process is the root process of a new process group.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.CreationFlags.SeperateWOWVDM
member.summary: This flag is only valid starting a 16-bit Windows-based application. If set, the new process runs in a private Virtual DOS Machine (VDM). By default, all 16-bit Windows-based applications run in a single, shared VDM.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.CreationFlags.UnicodeEnvironment
member.summary: Indicates the format of the lpEnvironment parameter. If this flag is set, the environment block pointed to by lpEnvironment uses Unicode characters.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.CreationFlags.DefaultErrorMode
member.summary: The new process does not inherit the error mode of the calling process.

member.name: T:BabBot.Common.RunAs.FillAttributes
member.summary: The initial text and background colors if a new console window is created in a console application.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.FillAttributes.BackgroundIntensity
member.summary: Background color is intensified.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.FillAttributes.BackgroundRed
member.summary: Background color contains red.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.FillAttributes.BackgroundGreen
member.summary: Background color contains green.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.FillAttributes.BackgroundBlue
member.summary: Background color contains blue.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.FillAttributes.ForegroundIntensity
member.summary: Text color is intensified.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.FillAttributes.ForegroundRed
member.summary: Text color contains red.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.FillAttributes.ForegroundGreen
member.summary: Text color contains green.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.FillAttributes.ForegroundBlue
member.summary: Text color contains blue.

member.name: T:BabBot.Common.RunAs.LogonFlags
member.summary: Logon option.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.LogonFlags.WithProfile
member.summary: Log on, then load the user's profile in the HKEY_USERS registry key. The function returns after the profile has been loaded. Loading the profile can be time-consuming, so it is best to use this value only if you must access the information in the HKEY_CURRENT_USER registry key.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.LogonFlags.NetworkCredentialsOnly
member.summary: Log on, but use the specified credentials on the network only. The new process uses the same token as the caller, but the system creates a new logon session within LSA, and the process uses the specified credentials as the default credentials.

member.name: T:BabBot.Common.RunAs.PriorityFlags
member.summary: Controls the new process's priority class, which is used to determine the scheduling priorities of the process's threads.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.PriorityFlags.NormalPriority
member.summary: Process with no special scheduling needs.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.PriorityFlags.IdlePriority
member.summary: Process whose threads run only when the system is idle and are preempted by the threads of any process running in a higher priority class. An example is a screen saver. The idle priority class is inherited by child processes.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.PriorityFlags.HighPriority
member.summary: Process that performs time-critical tasks that must be executed immediately for it to run correctly. The threads of a high-priority class process preempt the threads of normal or idle priority class processes.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.PriorityFlags.RealTimePriority
member.summary: Process that has the highest possible priority. The threads of a real-time priority class process preempt the threads of all other processes, including operating system processes performing important tasks.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.PriorityFlags.BelowNormalPriority
member.summary: Process that has priority above idle but below normal processes.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.PriorityFlags.AboveNormalPriority
member.summary: Process that has priority above normal but below high processes.

member.name: T:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags
member.summary: Determines whether certain StartUpInfo members are used when the process creates a window.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags.UseShowWindow
member.summary: If this value is not specified, the wShowWindow member is ignored.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags.UseSize
member.summary: If this value is not specified, the dwXSize and dwYSize members are ignored.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags.UsePosition
member.summary: If this value is not specified, the dwX and dwY members are ignored.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags.UseCountChars
member.summary: If this value is not specified, the dwXCountChars and dwYCountChars members are ignored.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags.UseFillAttribute
member.summary: If this value is not specified, the dwFillAttribute member is ignored.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags.RunFullScreen
member.summary: Indicates that the process should be run in full-screen mode, rather than in windowed mode.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags.ForceOnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the cursor is in feedback mode after CreateProcess is called. The system turns the feedback cursor off after the first call to GetMessage.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags.ForceOffFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the feedback cursor is forced off while the process is starting. The Normal Select cursor is displayed.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags.UseStandardHandles
member.summary: Sets the standard input, standard output, and standard error handles for the process to the handles specified in the hStdInput, hStdOutput, and hStdError members of the StartUpInfo structure. If this value is not specified, the hStdInput, hStdOutput, and hStdError members of the STARTUPINFO structure are ignored.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags.UseHotKey
member.summary: When this flag is specified, the hStdInput member is to be used as the hotkey value instead of the standard-input pipe.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags.UseMonitor
member.summary: When this flag is specified, the StartUpInfo's hStdOutput member is used to specify a handle to a monitor, on which to start the new process. This monitor handle can be obtained by any of the multiple-monitor display functions (i.e. EnumDisplayMonitors, MonitorFromPoint, MonitorFromWindow, etc...).

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags.UseIcon
member.summary: Use the HICON specified in the hStdOutput member (incompatible with UseMonitor).

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags.TitleShortcut
member.summary: Program was started through a shortcut. The lpTitle contains the shortcut path.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfoFlags.Screensaver
member.summary: The process starts with normal priority. After the first call to GetMessage, the priority is lowered to idle.

member.name: T:BabBot.Common.RunAs.ProcessInformation
member.summary: The ProcessInformation structure is filled in by either the CreateProcess, CreateProcessAsUser, CreateProcessWithLogonW, or CreateProcessWithTokenW function with information about the newly created process and its primary thread.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.ProcessInformation.hProcess
member.summary: Handle to the newly created process. The handle is used to specify the process in all functions that perform operations on the process object.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.ProcessInformation.hThread
member.summary: Handle to the primary thread of the newly created process. The handle is used to specify the thread in all functions that perform operations on the thread object.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.ProcessInformation.dwProcessId
member.summary: Value that can be used to identify a process. The value is valid from the time the process is created until the time the process is terminated.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.ProcessInformation.dwThreadId
member.summary: Value that can be used to identify a thread. The value is valid from the time the thread is created until the time the thread is terminated.

member.name: T:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo
member.summary: The STARTUPINFO structure is used with the CreateProcess, CreateProcessAsUser, and CreateProcessWithLogonW functions to specify the window station, desktop, standard handles, and appearance of the main window for the new process.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.cb
member.summary: Size of the structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.lpReserved
member.summary: Reserved. Set this member to NULL before passing the structure to CreateProcess.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.lpDesktop
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies either the name of the desktop, or the name of both the desktop and window station for this process. A backslash in the string indicates that the string includes both the desktop and window station names.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.lpTitle
member.summary: For console processes, this is the title displayed in the title bar if a new console window is created. If NULL, the name of the executable file is used as the window title instead. This parameter must be NULL for GUI or console processes that do not create a new console window.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.dwX
member.summary: The x offset of the upper left corner of a window if a new window is created, in pixels.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.dwY
member.summary: The y offset of the upper left corner of a window if a new window is created, in pixels.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.dwXSize
member.summary: The width of the window if a new window is created, in pixels.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.dwYSize
member.summary: The height of the window if a new window is created, in pixels.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.dwXCountChars
member.summary: If a new console window is created in a console process, this member specifies the screen buffer width, in character columns.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.dwYCountChars
member.summary: If a new console window is created in a console process, this member specifies the screen buffer height, in character rows.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.dwFillAttribute
member.summary: The initial text and background colors if a new console window is created in a console application.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.dwFlags
member.summary: Bit field that determines whether certain StartUpInfo members are used when the process creates a window.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.wShowWindow
member.summary: This member can be any of the SW_ constants defined in Winuser.h.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.cbReserved2
member.summary: Reserved for use by the C Runtime; must be zero.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.lpReserved2
member.summary: Reserved for use by the C Runtime; must be null.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.hStdInput
member.summary: A handle to be used as the standard input handle for the process.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.hStdOutput
member.summary: A handle to be used as the standard output handle for the process.

member.name: F:BabBot.Common.RunAs.StartUpInfo.hStdError
member.summary: A handle to be used as the standard error handle for the process.

member.summary: Bot management thread
